name: Agriculture Production Systems
description: Course Description: Broad survey of the diverse aspects of Colorado agriculture.
column11: Registration Information: Required field trips.Term Offered: Fall.

name: History of Agriculture in the United States
description: Course Description: Relationships in agriculture. Historical/Native American/early practices, industrial agriculture, technologies, philosophy, green revolution.

name: Understanding Agricultural Education  Credit
description: Course Description: Understanding different agricultural education systems. Understanding delivery models of agricultural education programs.

name: Technical Tool Applications in Ag Education
description: Course Description: Development of safe competencies and applications related to power and technical tools utilized in school-based agricultural education programs.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and lab.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Power, Structure, and Tech. Systems in Ag Ed
description: Course Description: Development of competencies and theory related to agricultural power, structure, and technical  systems utilized in school-based agricultural education programs.
column11: Registration Information: Must register for lecture and laboratory.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Technology Lab for Ag Education  Credit
description: Course Description: Laboratory applications related to the power, structure, and technical systems pathway utilized in school-based agricultural education programs.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AGED 240, may be taken concurrently or AGED 244, may be taken concurrently.
column11: Registration Information: May be taken twice for credit.Term Offered: Spring.

name: Program Design and Evaluation in Ag. Literacy
description: Course Description: Design and evaluate programs in agricultural literacy using experiential methods.

name: Developing School-Based Ag Education Programs
description: Course Description: Developing knowledge in the approach and delivery of school-based agricultural education programs.

name: Methods of Agricultural Literacy
description: Course Description: Prepare and conduct agricultural literacy instructional units to work with a variety of audiences and instructional topics.

name: Managing Experiences in Ag Ed Laboratories  Credit
description: Course Description: Theory, management and pedagogy of delivering safety instruction and experiential curriculum in secondary agricultural education laboratory settings.

name: A  Practicum: Agricultural Literacy
description: Course Description: Experience in the agricultural literacy field.

name: B  Practicum: On-site Experience in Agricultural Outreach
description: Course Description: Formalized training on conducting non-formal agricultural education at the National Western Stock Show.

name: C  Practicum: FFA
description: Course Description: Formalized training on managing FFA experiences, including Career Development Events and Leadership Development Events.

name: Internship
description: Course Description:

name: Independent Study
description: Course Description:

name: Group Study
description: Course Description:

name: American Agricultural Values and Ideology
description: Course Description: Explore how people have conceptualized agriculture in the United States, how agricultural ideologies have shaped our agricultural values, and how differing agricultural ideologies impact the work in agriculture today and in the future.
column11: Registration Information: Senior standing. Written consent of instructor. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Spring (even years).

name: 4-H and Youth Programs in Extension
description: Course Description: Youth programs in Extension, including 4-H, are America’s largest youth development organization reaching almost 6 million youth. Preparation for a successful career working with 4-H/ youth development programs in Extension as well as other related non-formal education programs.
column11: Registration Information: Offered as an online course only. This is a partial semester course. Credit not allowed for both AGED 520 and AGED 581A1.Term Offered: Summer.

name: Agricultural and Extension Teaching
description: Course Description: Use research on effective teaching methods to define and deliver educational programs, courses and presentations in formal and non-formal educational settings in agriculture. Apply organization and instructional methods to evaluate, plan, deliver and assess effective educational programs.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Sections may be offered: Online.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Ag Ed Laboratory Management and Safety
description: Course Description: Theory, management, and pedagogy of delivering safety instruction and experiential curriculum in secondary agricultural education laboratory settings.

name: Internship in Extension
description: Course Description: First-hand experiences in extension programming.
column11: Registration Information: Graduate standing. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Evaluation and Applied Research in Extension
description: Course Description: Train extension and other outreach specialists in the basics of program evaluation and research methods. Work with real world scenarios and/or their own field experiences to learn how to strategically design evaluation plans and effectively analyze the data collected. Emphasizing how to improve programming with the collected data.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Sections may be offered: Online. Credit not allowed for both AGED 600 and EDRM 600.Term Offered: Spring (odd years).

name: Agricultural Education Seminar  Credit
description: Course Description: Agricultural education focusing on current trends in Extension.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AGED 587, may be taken concurrently. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Enrolled in the Master of Agriculture Extension Education or the Graduate Certificate of Teaching in Extension. Sections may be offered: Online.

name: Agricultural Education Research
description: Course Description:
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  None. Restriction: Must be a: Graduate, Professional.
column11: Registration Information: Admission to the Master of Agriculture in Agricultural Sciences, Teacher Development Specialization. Written consent of instructor.
